steps.title: Prepare the Mutton Marinade
steps.description: In a bowl, add yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, fennel powder, dry ginger powder, and salt.

steps.title: Marinate the Mutton
steps.description: Add the cleaned mutton to the marinade. Mix thoroughly until the mutton is evenly coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight for best flavor.

steps.title: Rinse and Soak the Rice
steps.description: Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes. Drain before cooking.

steps.title: Slice the Onions
steps.description: Thinly slice the onions and set aside for frying.

steps.title: Fry the Onions
steps.description: Heat oil and half of the ghee in a large pan. Add sliced onions and fry on medium heat until golden brown and caramelized. Remove half and keep aside for layering later.

steps.title: Temper Whole Spices
steps.description: In the same pan with remaining onions, add green cardamoms, black cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, bay leaf, and star anise. Sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant.

steps.title: Cook the Mutton
steps.description: Add the marinated mutton to the pan. Cook on medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the meat is tender and oil starts to separate from the masala.

steps.title: Boil Water for Rice
steps.description: In a separate large pot, bring water to a boil and add salt to taste.

steps.title: Parboil the Rice
steps.description: Add the soaked rice to the boiling water. Cook until the grains are 70% done—firm but not fully cooked. Drain the rice and set aside.

steps.title: Soak Saffron in Milk
steps.description: Warm the milk slightly. Add saffron strands to the milk and let it infuse for at least 10 minutes.

steps.title: Prepare for Layering
steps.description: Chop fresh coriander and mint leaves. Keep rose water, kewra water, raisins, cashews, and fried onions ready.

steps.title: First Layer of Mutton
steps.description: In a heavy-bottomed pot, spread half of the cooked mutton evenly at the bottom.

steps.title: First Layer of Rice and Garnishes
steps.description: Add a layer of half the rice over the mutton. Sprinkle half of the fried onions, raisins, cashews, saffron milk, rose water, kewra water (optional), and herbs.

steps.title: Second Layer of Mutton
steps.description: Spread the remaining mutton on top of the rice layer.

steps.title: Second Layer of Rice and Garnishes
steps.description: Add the remaining rice and repeat the garnishing with leftover fried onions, raisins, cashews, saffron milk, rose water, and herbs.

steps.title: Add Ghee and Seal Pot
steps.description: Drizzle remaining ghee on top. Seal the pot tightly with dough or foil and place a lid over it.

steps.title: Dum Cooking (Steam Method)
steps.description: Place the sealed pot over a low flame or on a heavy skillet (tava) to avoid direct heat. Let it cook for 20–25 minutes, allowing flavors to meld.

steps.title: Rest and Serve
steps.description: Turn off the heat and let the biryani rest for 10 minutes. Gently mix before serving to retain the long grains. Serve hot with raita or Kashmiri chutney.
